title: Data-Driven Project Learning for Tinnitus Diagnosis and Treatment Monitoring

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics and statistics knowledge, fundamental smartphone/tablet utilization skills
context.additional_context: Learners analyze tinnitus diagnostic data using simplified machine learning models for real-life problem-solving. Actual experimental data is not provided; reconstructed sample datasets for educational purposes are used.

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically interpret data distributions by frequency bands (central frequency, skewness, etc.).
Learners can design a project to classify tinnitus conditions by applying the fundamental principles of machine learning models.
Learners can explain the key predictive factors of a diagnostic model by interpreting SHAP analysis results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
